summary:
MDMA, often known as ecstasy or molly, is a drug that can make people feel more energy, empathy, and happiness. It was first made in 1912 and was used to help with therapy in the 1970s. But it became a popular party drug in the 1980s.

MDMA can be dangerous, causing blurred vision, fast heartbeats, and even death in rare cases. It can also lead to addiction and memory loss if used a lot. It's illegal in most countries, but some places are studying its use for medical reasons, like treating PTSD.
title: MDMA
